titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Saul Wellman Papers ALBA.139

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-06-01T16:46-0400

change.item: Edited by Hanan Ohayon for compliance with DACS and Tamiment Required Elements for Archival Description

did.abstract: Saul Wellman was a veteran of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade. The collection consists mainly of published and unpublished material about the Spanish Civil War, including articles, clippings, periodicals, ephemera, veteran memoirs, and student writings.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Saul Wellman was a veteran of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, and was indicted under the Smith Act in Michigan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists mainly of published and unpublished material about the Spanish Civil War, including articles, clippings, periodicals, ephemera, veteran memoirs, and student writings.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: This collection came to New York University in January 2001 as part of the original acquisition of ALBA collections, formerly housed at Brandeis University.
